> @1ssqq1lxr Origin sql is "SELECT d.oid, d.datname AS databasename, d.datacl, pg_get_userbyid(d.datdba) AS databaseowner, d.datcollate, d.datctype, shobj_description(d.oid, 'pg_database') AS description, d.datconnlimit, t.spcname, d.encoding, pg_encoding_to_char(d.encoding) AS encodingname FROM pg_database d LEFT JOIN pg_tablespace t ON d.dattablespace = t.oid ::: DataSources: initds_master" , right?

origin sql is "SELECT d.oid, d.datname AS databasename, d.datacl, pg_get_userbyid(d.datdba) AS databaseowner, d.datcollate, d.datctype, shobj_description(d.oid, 'pg_database') AS description, d.datconnlimit, t.spcname, d.encoding, pg_encoding_to_char(d.encoding) AS encodingname FROM pg_database d LEFT JOIN pg_tablespace t ON d.dattablespace = t.oid"     "::: DataSources: initds_master"  getdatasouce log ?

Hi @manbo1987

You mean the SQL of `the store procedure`?  Since the SQL of `store procedure` is diverse, I can not guarantee it. But ShardingSphere will change the table names of your SQL can send it to databases at the base. No matter what SQL it is.

env:
mysql-connector-java: 8.0.20
mybatis-plus-boot-starter: 3.3.2
sharding-jdbc-spring-boot-starter: 4.1.1

when your entity is LocalDateTime ,so the `MyBatis  TypeHandler` is `LocalDateTimeTypeHandler#getNullableResult`,

but this is a unsupport operation in ShardingJdbc `AbstractUnsupportedOperationResultSet#getObject(columnIndex,type) throws SQLFeatureNotSupportedException` 


to resolve this question must override method in `ShardingResultSet` but the parent method is final tag

docs5.x branch is unuseful, will be removed now.

I've prepared a demo and reproduced the error result.

After reading some code and debuging, java.sql.Types.ARRAY=2003, many types could be used as array and they have their own unique type oid, e.g. INT4_ARRAY=1007, INT8_ARRAY=1016, so jdbc array columnType(2003) is not enough to get exact array oid. There are 2 possible solutions for now:

1, Get resultSetMetaData from queryResponse.queryResults, use PostgreSQL's implementation PgResultSetMetaData, get field of column index via java reflection, then get type oid. The disadvantage is: a) direct dependency of postgresql jdbc driver, b) once the internal implementation of PostgreSQL jdbc driver changed, then it doesn't work.

2, Get resultSetMetaData from queryResponse.queryResults, use getColumnTypeName(column) method to get database specific type name (e.g. integer array is _int4), then translate it to type oid (e.g. 1007), PostgreSQL has the mapping definition.

I prefer solution 2, though it need more code.

`getObject(columnIndex,type)` has supported in master branch now.

see:  shardingsphere-jdbc/shardingsphere-jdbc-core/src/main/java/org/apache/shardingsphere/driver/jdbc/core/resultset/ShardingSphereResultSet.java
which version did you use?

This feature sounds great!

1. You have to config your sharding tables in config file.
Others are not necessary to be configured.
2. And multiple datasources are supported too(But I suggestion the first way).

My idea is to create multiple sharding - JDBC data sources, namely ShardingDataSourceFactory. CreateDataSource more, each data source is a sub-database and set himself to the default data source, in this way, the sub-tables will be configuration, but a lot of non-sub-tables without configuration can also be automatically routed to the current data source of the sub-database.

In my service invocation ShardingDataSourceFactory CreateDataSource many times, and according to the business logic to switch.I want to avoid sub-databse with a lot of tables that don't need to be sharded, and I don't want to maintain them in code or configuration files.

Ihave to config my sharding tables in config fileï¼Œbut, i have a lot of non-sharding-tables need routed. i dont want
define thems.

@kimmking

Hi @peng-ran Thanks for your issue.
If there are sharding tables and non-sharding tables in your project which you do not want to configure, you can consider `defaultDatasource`. The documents will give you more detail.
>  Default Datasource: All unconfigured tables will be routed here.

Hi @johnny2002 
Thanks for your feedback, we will fix it before our next release!

@tristaZero  3q. but defaultDatasource only one datasource, a lot of non-sub-tables need route to sub-database. so i invoke ShardingDataSourceFactory. CreateDataSource more, each of  them defaultDatasource  is a  sub-database.
I wanted to know that ShardingJDBC can have multiple sharding-jdbc data source instances that are secure in the process, and a single sharding-jdbc data source would not satisfy my scenario

Hi @65725738 
Thanks for your question.
IMO,  this is not about DBCP and more possibility is the sharding configuration. Could you compare your configuration with [4.1.1 examples](https://github.com/apache/shardingsphere/tree/4.1.1/examples/sharding-jdbc-example/sharding-example) ?

> 
> 
> For Sharding-JDBC, @sandynz , can you reproduce this problem?
> For Sharding-Proxy, it will be resolved via #6408 .

Reproduced.

Verified with ShardingSphere 5.0.0-RC1-SNAPSHOT , revision: cf3b2eda .
DataSource is created via: YamlShardingSphereDataSourceFactory.createDataSource(getResourceAsFile("META-INF/sharding-tables-pg-jdbc.yaml")) .
Exception thrown when querying, logs:
```
[main] INFO ShardingSphere-SQL - Actual SQL: ds ::: select * from array_tc_1 where id = ? ::: [3]
Exception in thread "main" java.sql.SQLFeatureNotSupportedException: getArray
	at org.apache.shardingsphere.driver.jdbc.unsupported.AbstractUnsupportedOperationResultSet.getArray(AbstractUnsupportedOperationResultSet.java:191)
	at test.shardingsphere.sharding.pg.array.PgArrayTcDao.query(PgArrayTcDao.java:46)
	at test.shardingsphere.sharding.pg.array.ShardingPgArrayJdbcTest.main(ShardingPgArrayJdbcTest.java:17)
```
Since ShardingSphereResultSet has't implement java.sql.ResultSet.getArray(columnLabel) method:
```
    public final Array getArray(final String columnLabel) throws SQLException {
        throw new SQLFeatureNotSupportedException("getArray");
    }
```
